snippet: The flooding from the Gowanus Canal has raised questions about inadequate infrastructure and filthy waters.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column discusses fact that floodwaters that poured from the Gowanus Canal into nearby South Brooklyn neighborhoods brought dangerous levels of contamination from the Superfund waterway; says concerns about inadequate infrastructure and filthy waters are especially pressing in the face of a great deal of looming development in the area.
lead_paragraph: The flooding from the Gowanus Canal has raised questions about inadequate infrastructure and filthy waters.

headline.seo: Gowanus Canal Flooding Brings Contamination Concerns
headline.main: In Brooklyn, Worrying About Not Only Flooding but Also What’s in Water
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, Worrying About Not Only Flooding But Also What’s in Water
